content: knitted dachshund jacket worked with dk yarn and 3 mm circular needles abbreviations gauge is 11 stitches per 2 inches wide and 17 row k knit per 2 inch in stocking stitch use needles according to the gauge required as gustave is fairly slight in p purl size you might need a bigger needle for a bigger gauge if you have a larger daxie st/sts stitch/stitches skill level easy increase increase skills needed cast on cast off knit purl increase decrease decrease decrease starting with the neck ** if you don t want a double knit fabric only knit 20 row and don t fold it over cast on 72 sts join to work in the round place a r48 k23 sts increase 1 st slip stitchmarker k4 sts slip marker at the beginning of round stitchmarker increase 1 st k51 sts 80sts r1-40 k2 p2 to end 72sts r49 k to end r41 in order to get a double fabric knit through r50 k24 sts increase 1 st slip stitchmarker k4 sts slip both r41 and r1 at the same time stitchmarker increase 1 st k52 sts 82sts r51 k to end you are now going to work increases on every r52 k25 sts increase 1 st slip stitchmarker k4 sts slip second round for the chest stitchmarker increase 1 st k53 sts 84sts r53 k to end r42 k20 sts increase 1 st place marker k4 sts place r54 k26 sts increase 1 st slip stitchmarker k4 sts slip marker increase 1 st k48 sts 74sts total stitchmarker increase 1 st k54 sts 86sts r43 k to end r55 k to end r44 k21 sts increase 1 st slip stitchmarker k4 sts slip r56 k27 sts increase 1 st slip stitchmarker k4 sts slip stitchmarker increase 1 st k49 sts 76sts stitchmarker increase 1 st k55 sts 88sts r45 k to end r57-66 k to end r46 k22 sts increase 1 st slip stitchmarker k4 sts slip r67 k12 sts cast off 8 sts on either side of the stitchmarker increase 1 st k50 sts 78sts stitchmarkers k20 sts cast off 7sts k40 sts put r47 k to end your 52 back sts on a spare needle and cut your thread pick up the 20 live sts for the chest panel chest panel worked flat now working flat pick up your thread r37 k56 sts r1 k20 sts across r38 cast off 3 sts p53 sts r2 p20 sts across r39 cast off 3 sts k50 sts r3-12 repeat r1&2 r40 cast off 2 sts p48 sts cut thread leave your 20 sts live and put them on a r41 cast off 2 st k46 sts spare needle r42 cast off 2 st p44 sts r43 cast off 1 st k43 sts back panel worked flat r44 cast off 1 st p42 sts join a new thread r45 cast off 1 st k41 sts r1 k54 sts across r46 cast off 1 st p40 sts r2 p54 sts
